---
title: Wood Environment Infrastructure
author: ''
date: '2022-11-16'
slug: wood_environment_infrastructure
categories: []
tags: []
images:
  - /img/cover.png
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $408.1K
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with Wood Environment Infrastructure. The average
  contract duration was 0.78 years, and the average contract value
  (not including contracts under $10k) was $56.4K. The longest
  contract was 4.45 years. The largest contract by value (including
  amendments) was $385.2K.
lookup_name: 'WOOD ENVIRONMENT INFRASTRUCTURE'
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '408.1K'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts: '53'
s431_number_of_contracts_with_amendments: '15'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '28%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage: '126%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments: '1.53'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value: '528.5K'
s424_mean_duration: '0.78'
s421_mean_contract_value: '56.4K'
s425_max_duration: '4.45'
s422_max_contract_value: '385.2K'
---
